AboutPage.title: Tracing the Roots of the Batak People
AboutPage.subtitle: A journey into the highland culture of North Sumatra, where ancient lineages weave the fabric of society.

one.title: Who are the Batak?
one.content1: The Batak people embrace a rich tapestry of ethnic groups from North Sumatra, Indonesia. United by shared myths and a distinct language family, we are known for our strong adherence to <bold>Adat</bold> (customary law) and a social structure that binds us together.
one.content2: From the intricate <bold>Gorga</bold> carvings to the majestic <bold>Jabu Bolon</bold> houses, our culture is a testament to agility and resilience. But our greatest monument is not built of stone or woodâ€”it is built of names.

two.title: Dalihan Na Tolu: The Three Pillars
two.content1: Our society stands firm on <bold>Dalihan Na Tolu</bold> (The Three Stoves). This philosophy dictates the social roles of <bold>Hula-hula</bold> (wife-givers), <bold>Boru</bold> (wife-receivers), and <bold>Dongan Tubu</bold> (clan brothers).
two.content2: It teaches us: <bold>Somba marhula-hula</bold> (Respect the wife-givers), <bold>Elek marboru</bold> (Persuade the wife-receivers), and <bold>Manat mardongan tubu</bold> (Be cautious with clan brothers). This is the compass of our social life.

three.title: Tarombo: The Sacred Lineage
three.content1: <bold>Tarombo</bold> is more than a family tree; it is our history book and our identity card. It traces our patrilineal descent back to <bold>Si Raja Batak</bold>. Knowing your Tarombo means knowing exactly where you stand in the grand scheme of the Batak universe.
three.content2: Traditionally, tarombos were passed down orally or hand-drawn on paper diagrams kept preciously by families. Today, many exist as simple digital photos or files, but the essence remains the same: a fundamental pillar of Batak culture connecting the present generation to their ancestral roots.

batak.title: Preserve Identity
batak.desc: To ensure every Batak descendant, no matter where they are born, can trace their roots and understand their place in the Dalihan Na Tolu.

indonesia.title: Enrich Heritage
indonesia.desc: To contribute a detailed, living archive to Indonesia's diverse cultural mosaic, showcasing the depth of Nusantara's kinship systems.

world.title: Global Archive
world.desc: To offer the world a window into one of the most sophisticated and well-preserved anthropological lineage systems in existence.

five.title: Martarombo: Connect to Your Roots
five.content: There is a saying: <bold>"Jolo tinittip sanggar, laho bahen huru-huan. Jolo sinungkun marga, asa binoto partuturan."</bold> (Cut the reeds to make a handle; ask the clan to know the relationship.) Join us in mapping the great Batak family tree.

header.title: Manjujung Baringin
header.subtitle: Upholding the Banyan Tree. Your knowledge strengthens the roots of our shared heritage.

why.title: Every Name Counts
why.p1: Just as the <bold>Baringin</bold> (Banyan tree) provides shelter with its many roots and branches, our Tarombo protects our identity. Missing names are like broken branches.
why.p2: By recording your elders, parents, and children, you ensure they take their rightful place in history. You are not just entering data; you are performing an act of cultural devotion.

how.title: How to Contribute
how.subtitle: Join the community effort in four simple steps.

one.title: Join the Community
one.desc: Create a contributor account to begin your journey.

two.title: Share Knowledge
two.desc: Share your lineage diagram or consult your Punguan Marga (Clan Association) or Clan Chief for accurate information.

three.title: Community Review
three.desc: Admins and elders verify the data to ensure the Tarombo remains accurate.

four.title: Preserve Forever
four.desc: Watch the tree grow as your contributions link families together.

cta.title: Ready to leave your mark?
cta.text: Don't let the stories fade. Grab your records, call your grandparents, and help us digitized the wisdom of our ancestors.

DonationPage.title: Siurupan: Mutual Assistance
DonationPage.description: Support the digital preservation of Batak culture.

content.p1: In Batak culture, <bold>Siurupan</bold> means helping one another for a common good. This project is maintained by volunteers dedicated to keeping our history alive.
content.p2: Your donation helps cover server costs, development of new features (like automated clan matching), and research efforts to verify ancient lineages.
content.p3: Help us keep this digital Jabu Bolon standing strong for the next generation. Mauliate godang!
